intro: Lacmellea abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a flattened, ribbon-like body that lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophores, are borne on the upper surface of the thallus. Lacmellea abbreviata is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
